name: market for containerboard, unspecified | containerboard, unspecified | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/25802/documentation

This unit process includes transportation information from containerboard facility to box plants, it represents the market for US-average containerboard. "containerboard, unspecified" in the US consists of an average mix of kraftliner (50.7%), 100% recycled linerboard (16.1%), semichemical corrugating medium (18.8%) and 100% recycled corrugating medium (14.4%). ;The ecoinvent "containerboard production, unspecified" in the US therefore corresponds to an average of "containerboard production, kraftliner", "containerboard production, testliner", "containerboard production, semichemical fluting", "containerboard production, recycled fluting" in other geographies.;Containerboard is the umbrella term for two different types of board, linerboard and fluting medium, which are both required to produce corrugated board. Linerboard is a flat layer of board, which can be further distinguished in kraftliner and testliner, depending on whether it is of virgin or recycled origin, respectively. Fluting medium is the corrugated middle layer between a top and bottom layer of linerboard. Together all three layers constitute corrugated board. Virgin fluting medium is commonly called semichemical fluting, while recycled fluting can also be called wellenstoff. Because US data do not allow separate inventories for the distinct types an unspecified containerboard was introduced.;[This dataset is meant to replace the following datasets:]

Out gate of containerboard facility

In gate of box plant

exchanges.description: Estimated value based on the 2012 US Commodity flow survey (CFS). SCTG #27. Truck: 80.1%, 262 km. Rail: 19.8%, 1511 km. Multiple and unknown modes from the CFS were neglected.
